I have tried that, and it didn't help. I also used -verbose:gc to verify
that it wasn't spending all its time in garbage collection. I know that ant
has its own classloader... am starting to wonder if it's releasing all its
resources properly.
 
--Dan
 


  _____  

From: David Corbin [mailto:dcorbin@...] 
Sent: Saturday, February 28, 2004 5:28 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] ant junit performance problem


On Friday 27 February 2004 12:16, danrabe wrote:
> A full run of our test suite using ant takes about 4 minutes using
> fork="true". The same test suite run in Intelilj IDEA takes less than
> a minute. I figured this was because I had fork="true" on the junit
> task, so I changed it to fork="false". The test execution got
> marginally slower, and eventually I got an OutOfMemoryError.
>

Have you tried increasing the Heap size used when you invoke your suite from

Ant? "<jvmarg>-Xmx256m</jvmarg>" if I remember correctly.  If you're short
on 
RAM, you're going to have a lot of garbage collection going on.


-- 
David Corbin <dcorbin@...>
